import Mathlib

variable {R : Type u} [CommSemiring R]
variable {A : Type v} [AddCommMonoid A] [Module R A]
variable {B : Type w} [AddCommMonoid B] [Module R B]
variable (S : Type x) [Semiring S] [Algebra R S]

open scoped TensorProduct

def do_we_have_this (œÜ : A ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S) (œà : B ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S) : A ‚Üí‚Çó[R] B ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S :=
  let a : A ‚äó[R] B ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S ‚äó[R] S := TensorProduct.map œÜ œà
  let Œº : S ‚äó[R] S ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S := LinearMap.mul' R S
  let t := Œº.comp a
  TensorProduct.curry t

example (œÜ : A ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S) (œà : B ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S) (a : A) (b : B) :
  do_we_have_this S œÜ œà a b  = œÜ a * œà b := rfl

import Mathlib

suppress_compilation

universe u v w x

open TensorProduct

namespace Coalgebra
variable {R : Type u} {A : Type v}
variable [CommSemiring R] [AddCommMonoid A] [Module R A] [Coalgebra R A]
variable {S : Type w} [Semiring S] [Algebra R S] --Maybe commSemiring needed?

variable {B : Type x} [AddCommMonoid B] [Module R B] in
abbrev do_we_have_this (œÜ : A ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S) (œà : B ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S) : A ‚Üí‚Çó[R] B ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S :=
  let a : A ‚äó[R] B ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S ‚äó[R] S := TensorProduct.map œÜ œà
  let Œº : S ‚äó[R] S ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S := LinearMap.mul' R S
  let t := Œº.comp a
  TensorProduct.curry t

/-- The `1` for the possible monoid structure on `A ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S` comes from the counit
of the coalgebra structure on `A` (composed with the canonical `R`-linear map `R ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S`). -/
def one : A ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S := (Algebra.linearMap R S).comp counit

/-- The `*` for the possible monoid structure on `A ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S` -/
def mul (œÜ œà : A ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S) : (A ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S) :=
    (TensorProduct.lift (do_we_have_this œÜ œà) : A ‚äó[R] A ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S).comp comul

-- Is this a monoid?

lemma one_mul (œÜ : A ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S) : mul one œÜ = œÜ := by
  sorry

  sorry

Kevin, Hopf algebras are a bit more complicated, so let's get the bialgebra story straight first. :-)

The usual way to describe a bialgebra is as something that is simultaneously an algebra and a coalgebra, and that the coalgebra structural morphisms are algebra maps and (in fact, equivalently) the algebra morphisms are coalgebra maps.
Another way to say that is that a bialgebra is a comonoid object in the category of monoid objects in the category of R-modules.
And inevitably that is equivalent to the monoid objects in the comonoid objects in R-mod.

import Mathlib

-- attribute [pp_dot] LinearMap.comp
-- attribute [pp_dot] LinearMap.mul'
-- attribute [pp_dot] LinearMap.id

suppress_compilation

universe u v w

open TensorProduct

namespace Coalgebra
variable {R : Type u} {A : Type v}
variable [CommSemiring R] [AddCommMonoid A] [Module R A] [Coalgebra R A]
variable {S : Type w} [Semiring S] [Algebra R S]

/-- A proposed `*` for a possible semigroup structure on `A ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S` -/
def mul (œÜ œà : A ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S) : (A ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S) :=
(LinearMap.mul' R S).comp ((TensorProduct.map œÜ œà).comp comul)

instance : Mul (A ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S) := ‚ü®mul‚ü©

/-- A -(comul)-> A ‚äó A -(œÜ ‚äó œà)-> S ‚äó S -(* on S)-> S -/
lemma mul_def (œÜ œà : A ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S) : œÜ * œà =
(LinearMap.mul' R S).comp ((TensorProduct.map œÜ œà).comp comul) := by rfl

variable (œÜ œà œÅ : A ‚Üí‚Çó[R] S)

-- dual of Coalgebra.coassoc
lemma Algebra.assoc :
    (LinearMap.mul' R S) ‚àò‚Çó ((LinearMap.mul' R S).lTensor S) ‚àò‚Çó (TensorProduct.assoc R S S S)
    = (LinearMap.mul' R S) ‚àò‚Çó ((LinearMap.mul' R S).rTensor S) := by
  ext a b c
  simp
  -- `ring` doesn't work on mul_assoc.symm??
  -- something weird going on?
  exact (mul_assoc a b c).symm -- ??

lemma mul_assoc : (œÜ * œà) * œÅ = œÜ * (œà * œÅ) := by
  simp only [mul_def]
  -- worked out proof on paper
  -- first commutative square
  have h := (map_map_comp_assoc_eq œÜ œà œÅ).symm -- contains two `TensorProduct.assoc`s
  -- now glue on another one
  replace h := congr_arg (. ‚àò‚Çó (LinearMap.rTensor A comul ‚àò‚Çó comul : A ‚Üí‚Çó[R]  (A ‚äó[R] A) ‚äó[R] A)) h
  dsimp at h
  -- and another
  replace h := congr_arg (((LinearMap.mul' R S) ‚àò‚Çó ((LinearMap.mul' R S).lTensor S)) ‚àò‚Çó .) h
  dsimp at h
  -- now need to remove both `TensorProduct.assoc`s from h using associativity
  -- and coassociativity axioms
  have hSassoc := Algebra.assoc (R := R) (S := S)
  have hAassoc := coassoc (R := R) (A := A)
  -- comping one way
  simp only [‚Üê LinearMap.comp_assoc] at h hSassoc
  rw [hSassoc] at h
  -- comping the other way
  simp only [LinearMap.comp_assoc] at h hAassoc
  rw [hAassoc] at h
  simpa [‚Üê LinearMap.comp_assoc] using h
